description: From Middle English forfenden (“to ward off, protect, prohibit”), equivalent to for- +‎ fend.

verbs.description: forfend (third-person singular simple present forfends, present participle forfending, simple past and past participle forfended)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To prohibit; to forbid; to avert.
examples: Clown: … You would know where Lord Anthonie is? I perceiue you. Shall I ſay he is in yond farme houſe? I deceiue you. Shall I tell you this wine is for him? the gods forfend, and ſo I end. Go fellow fighters theres a bob for ye.
